section.name: Overview
section.p: Beige-UML is an UML diagram editor. It has two user interfaces - ordinary desktop SWING and Android.

ol.li: Supports UML 2.4.1 compliant class diagram, package diagram, object diagram, sequence diagram and use case diagram.
It generates UML class diagram from Java source.
It's a doclet that generates standard Javadoc with UML class diagram.

section.p: Using Beige-UML to generate Javadocs has disadvantage - the resulting UML diagrams are PNG files, so they are increasing Javadoc files size too much. BeigeUML is planned to be ported into Beigesoft Document Writer, and writing to javadocs will be in SVG format (external file or html5 SVG).

This application you can download from https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/beigesoft/beige-uml-swing/ There beige-uml-swing-[VERSION]-jar-with-dependencies.jar is Swing application. Android version you can find in Google Play Store. Its source code you can download from https://github.com/demidenko05/beige-uml
Source of beige-android-demo (demo of Android tree/file-chooser, list-chooser etc.) you can find at http://sourceforge.net/projects/beigeuml/
